snippet:
Jabra , best known for its Bluetooth phone accessories, is making its first foray into Bluetooth premium headphones with the $250  Revo Wireless .
   
While the Revo has the fashionably overstated bass sound, it also has an equalizer app s...
abstract: Gadgetwise blog; Jabra introduces its premium Revo Wireless headphones, priced at $250. Photo (S)

headline.main: Jabra’s Revo Allows You to Shape Your Sound

snippet: If a deal for Waze is concluded, it would give Facebook the ability to better deliver tailored ads and content to its 1.1 billion users.
abstract: Facebook is in serious discussion to buy leading mobile navigation and map service Waze in deal that some say could exceed $1 billion; if concluded, sale would allow Facebook to better deliver locally tailored ads and content to its 1.1 billion users.

headline.main: Facebook Said to Be in Talks With Mobile Map Service
headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Reported To Be in Negotiations With Mobile Map Service

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include a collection of dismal apartments in New York, a call for Apple to come up with a better way to manage phot...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include a collection of dismal apartments in New York, a call for Apple to come up with a better way to manage photos and Twitter establishing a beachhead in Sunnyvale, Calif.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Twitter in the Valley and  iPhoto Trouble

snippet: A publisher’s decision to remove copy protection from its e-books revives a debate over whether such features hurt or help revenue — and not just for books.
abstract: A publisher’s decision to remove copy protection from its e-books revives a debate over whether such features hurt or help revenue — and not just for books.

snippet: Incase, a popular case maker in San Francisco, began selling its first protective cases for the new Galaxy S4 phone, adding to the hundreds of thousands of accessories supporting Samsung products.
abstract: Incase, a popular case maker in San Francisco, began selling its first protective cases for the new Galaxy S4 phone, adding to the hundreds of thousands of accessories supporting Samsung products.

headline.main: Accessories Market Is Expanding for Samsung Phones

snippet: David Steinberg, chief of XL Marketing, says that entrepreneurs can learn a lot about people and understand them if they are more open and inquisitive.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features Q&A with XL Marketing chief executive David Steinberg, who discusses his career and management technique.

headline.main: He’s No Longer the Loudest Guy in the Room
headline.print_headline: He’s No Longer The Loudest Guy In the Room

snippet: After a surprising five-day rally, the day’s economic data was mostly positive, although all of the major indexes were weak.
abstract: Stock market retreats from nominal highs as Standard & Poor's 500-stock index slips after five days of gains; some analysts express surprise that rally lasted so long despite lack of positive economic news.

headline.main: After 5 Days of Gains, Momentum Dwindles
headline.print_headline: After 5 Days of Gains, Momentum Dwindles

snippet: A $3.25 million addition to the Brooklyn Public Library’s main branch includes a classroom, meeting rooms and space for laptop users, reflecting the library’s campaign to maintain relevancy.
abstract: A $3.25 million addition to the Brooklyn Public Library’s main branch includes a classroom, meeting rooms and space for laptop users, reflecting the library’s campaign to maintain relevancy.

headline.main: At Brooklyn Library's New Center, Books Are Secondary

snippet: Belt-tightening and the declining value of the yen helped Sony earn $435 million for the year. The big Japanese company forecast higher net income for 2014.
abstract: Sony reports annual net profit of 43 billion yen, or $435 million, up from loss of 456.7 billion yen, or $4.6 billion, one year earlier; is Sony's first annual profit in five years, but company's future continues to hinge on turning around its unprofitable electronics business.

headline.main: Sony Posts Annual Profit for First Time in 5 Years
headline.print_headline: Sony Posts Annual Profit For First Time in 5 Years

snippet: Prudence in using your phone can help thwart thieves, and there are ways to protect your information in the event the phone is stolen.
abstract: Tool Kit column; prudence in using your smartphone can help thwart thieves, and there are ways to protect your information in event phone is stolen.
